title: Virgin Galactic signs agreement to study suborbital spaceflights from Italian spaceport
summary:
Virgin Galactic has signed an agreement with the Italian government that brings the company a step closer to operating its suborbital spaceplanes in that country.
The post Virgin Galactic signs agreement to study suborbital spaceflights from Italian spaceport appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: HyPrSpace Achieves Key Milestone in Baguette One Rocket Development
summary:
French launch startup HyPrSpace has announced that it has completed preliminary design reviews (PDRs) for its Baguette One and Orbital Baguette One rockets. Founded in 2019, HyPrSpace is developing a micro-launcher rocket powered by a hybrid propulsion system. While the company has since pulled all information about its rockets from its website suggesting its design […]
The post HyPrSpace Achieves Key Milestone in Baguette One Rocket Development appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Earth from Space: Jakobshavn Glacier, Greenland
Growing a business: from apps to software for space on Proba-3
summary: A key element of ESA’s role as Europe’s space agency is the expansion of space knowhow, by encouraging new actors into the field. Case in point: a Polish software company previously specialising in smartphone apps took on the challenge of designing the operating system for the main instrument of Proba-3 – an ambitious double spacecraft mission to reveal secrets of the Sun’s fiery atmosphere, the corona.

title: Space Force to test modular satellite technology in upcoming mission
summary:
A "plug-and-play" satellite interface developed by The Aerospace Corporation will be used to build a small satellite for a tactically responsive space mission
The post Space Force to test modular satellite technology in upcoming mission appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 22 Starlink satellites on Falcon 9 rocket from California
summary: The launch from Vandenberg Space Force Base comes on the heels of leaders from the U.S. Space Force gathering to discuss how to adjust to a rapidly increasing launch cadence for both the Eastern Range and Western Range. Liftoff is set for 11:28 a.m. PST (2:28 p.m. EST, 1928 UTC).

title: Hubble Captures an Edge-On Spiral with Curve Appeal
summary: This NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope image features a spiral galaxy, named UGC 10043. We don’t see the galaxy’s spiral arms because we are seeing it from the side. Located roughly 150 million light-years from Earth in the constellation Serpens, UGC 10043 is one of the somewhat rare spiral galaxies that we see edge-on. This edge-on viewpoint makes […]

title: NASA Kennedy Top 24 Stories of 2024
summary: From sending crew members to the International Space Station to launching a spacecraft to Jupiter’s icy moon Europa to determine if it could support life, 2024 was a busy record setting year for NASA and its partners at Kennedy Space Center in Florida.
